freestyleModels.name: (Re)created Carrawburgh
description: Project for MLitt Ancient Cultures Dissertation, The Religious Landscape of Carrawburgh.
The goal was to understand the religious landscape of Carrawburgh using sensory archaeology and 3d modelling.
Carrawburgh is a Roman fort on Hadrian's Wall that had three shrines along the fort borders.
It is famous for Coventina's Well, which contained over 13,000 coins and was discovered in the 1800s by John Clayton.
It is also home to the Temple to Mithras and the shrine to the Nymphs and Genius Loci.

imageURLs.name: Carrawburgh c. AD 133
imageURLs.alt: (Re)Created model of the Roman fort at Carrawburgh circa AD 133. Contains the fort and Coventina's Well.

imageURLs.name: Carrawburgh c. AD 198
imageURLs.alt: (Re)Created model of the Roman fort at Carrawburgh circa AD 198. Contains the fort, mithraeum, and Coventina's Well.

imageURLs.name: Carrawburgh c. AD 300
imageURLs.alt: (Re)Created model of the Roman fort at Carrawburgh circa AD 300. Contains the fort, mithraeum, Shrine to the Nymphs and Genius Loci, and Coventina's Well.

freestyleModels.name: (Re)created Mithraeum
description: Project for MSc Dissertation, Remembering Mithras, Can VR be Used to Learn About the Past?
For this project, I developed a VR experience about the Temple to Mithras at Carrawburgh, and created an experiment to test if users remembered content from the experience.

imageURLs.name: Mithraeum today
imageURLs.alt: Front of the Carrawburgh mithraeum today. Rectangular stone base with casts of the altars in the apse.

imageURLs.name: (Re)Construction of the Carrawburgh Mithraeum.
imageURLs.alt: (Re)Construction of the Carrawburgh Mithraeum, stars on the celieng, painted walls, and altars.
